reasoning: Non-cutaneous melanoma includes ocular, mucosal, and acral melanomas (~0.7-1.2 per 100k globally). Uses incidence as primary metric for incident disease. GLOBOCAN 2005 data shows non-skin melanomas comprise ~5-10% of total melanomas with distinctly lower incidence than cutaneous forms.
source: Parkin DM et al. (2005). Global cancer statistics, 2002. CA Cancer J Clin. 55(2):74-108
